intro: Rollinia pterocarpa, commonly known as the Brazilian star-apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that develop into large, spiky fruits. The fruit has a thick, leathery rind and contains a sweet, white, fleshy pulp with edible seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible fruit.
